text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus daimingshanensis is a rare Asian species of trees in the beech family. It has been found only  in a small region of southern China, in the Daming Shan region of the Province of Guangxi.Quercus daimingshanensis is a tree up to 15 meters tall with hairless twigs and leaves as much as 7 cm long.
text.External links: line drawing, Flora of China Illustrations vol. 4, figure 375, drawing 9 at lower right
